7.description: Arthur's school puts together a play in honor of Elwood City's 100th anniversary. Unfortunately, a multitude of things backfire and create problems while the crew sets up.

7.title: Prunella Sees the Light/Return of the Snowball
7.description: Prunella plans a sleepover for her and Marina, but worries about offending Marina, because she is blind.; D.W finds the the snowball she lost six months ago in the freezer and tries not to lose it again.

7.title: D.W.'s Time Trouble/Buster's Amish Mismatch
7.description: D.W. imagines what it would be like if she switched ages with Arthur; After visiting an Amish community, Buster decides to take up their "simple" lifestyle.

7.title: The World of Tomorrow/Is There a Doctor in the House?
7.description: Out on a boring field trip, Binky sneaks into a new exhibit. Arthur and DW try to care of the house while their mom is sick.

7.title: Pick a Car, Any Car/Jenna's Bedtime Blues
7.description: When the Read family's car breaks down, they try to get it repaired. When Jenna is invited to Muffy's big slumber party, she is worried that everyone will learn she has a bed-wetting problem.

7.title: April 9th
7.description: A fire at the school affects Arthur and his friends.

8.title: Dear Adil/Bitzi's Break-Up
8.description: Arthur makes a new pen pal who lives in Turkey, but accidentally goes overboard with some of his questions; Buster's mom and her boyfriend break up and Buster does everything he can to put them together again.

8.title: Fernfern and the Secret of Moose Mountain/Thanks a Lot, Binky
8.description: Fern wants to climb Moose Mountain, but with Francine bickering with her, how can she enjoy herself? Meanwhile Binky feels unappreciated after helping Rattles, but learns what happens without acts of kindness.

8.title: Arthur's Snow Biz/Bugged
8.description: Arthur comes up with a great idea to charge money for a snow shoveling service, but when Buster invades his turf, it's not just a business, it's a battle. Meanwhile the Brain wakes up trapped in the body of a cockroach.

8.title: Fernkenstein's Monster/D.W. Dancing Queen
8.description: Inspired by how Mary Shelley wrote "Frankenstein", Fern holds a scary story contest, but is her story a little too scary?; Binky gives DW dance lessons, but he's the one who needs more practice.

8.title: Vomitrocious!/Sue Ellen Chickens Out
8.description: When Francine gets sick and vomits in the cafeteria, she worries that she will be made fun of. The Sugar Bowl is closing and Sue Ellen tries to stop a chicken company from buying.

8.title: Postcards from Buster!
8.description: Buster's going of to meet his estranged dad in beautiful New York City. Best of all, he's got a video camera from Bitzy to capture the whole experience.

8.title: Desk Wars/Desperately Seeking Stanley
8.description: Mr. Ratburn has decided to switch desks on the hottest day of the year, but none of the students can put up with having their personal belongings defaced. Meanwhile, Arthur has to give up his childhood teddy bear.

8.title: Muffy's Art Attack/Tales from the Crib
8.description: Muffy puts on an art show, but takes credit for some sculptures that actually made by Bailey, her butler. When Vicita's crib is replaced with a "big girl" bed, DW tells her the story of how she how she grew out of her crib.

8.title: Flea to Be You and Me/Kiss and Tell
8.description: Pal has a flea and tries to get rid of it, but the flea has had an interesting life and wants to share his story; D.W. tries to get a boy to kiss her, after Emily tells her she was kissed by one.

8.title: Big Horns George/*Bleep*
8.description: George writes a blues song; DW learns about swear words.

9.title: Castle in the Sky/Tipping the Scales
9.description: Arthur and his friends want to build a new tree house with a famous architect but they can't agree on what to build.

9.title: Francine's Big Top Trouble/George Blows His Top
9.description: Francine wants to do well at circus camp, but how can she if she's always living in Catherine's shadow? Meanwhile mild-mannered George isn't sure how to handle Buster's freeloading. Can this shy moose stand up for himself?

9.title: Arthur Weighs In/The Law of the Jungle Gym
9.description: Arthur worries he might be gaining weight; Muffy and Molly have a dispute over who controls the school jungle gym.

9.title: Buster's Green Thumb/My Fair Tommy
9.description: Tired of Buster's nasty rotten food collection, Bitzy makes him take it to the community garden for compost, where he develops a passion for tomato-growing. Meanwhile D.W. tries to help Tommy to behave so he can get a cupcake.

9.title: Lights, Camera, Opera!/All Worked Up!
9.description: Ed Crosswire wants to take his daughter to the opera, but Muffy isn't sure what to think. Will it really be sixteen hours of singing? She decides to give it a try, and gets an amazing experience.

9.title: Arthur Makes Waves/It Came from Beyond
9.description: D.W. wants to swim at a backyard pool belonging to Molly, the toughest bully in school. Can Molly and Arthur secretly be friends? Meanwhile Grandma Thora adopts a new little companion, but the neighborhood welcome is reluctant.

9.title: Three's a Crowd/'A' Is for Angry
9.description: Prunella and her mom both share a special bond over yoga, but when Marina joins in, will Prunella be left out? Meanwhile Arthur takes on Brain in a checkers match, but he finds the fan support too overwhelming.

9.title: The 'A' Team/Emily Swallows a Horse
9.description: Francine and the Brain make the city's elite traveling team, but is it missing the element of friendship? Meanwhile Emily is jealous of a glittery glass ball D.W. has found, and begins telling lies to get what she wants.

9.title: D.W. Beats All/Buster the Myth Maker
9.description: D.W. wants a drum set like what the Tibble Twins have, but her mother tells her she can't get one, so she'll have to improvise. Meanwhile Buster spreads around an urban legend, but can he find the truth behind it for once?

9.title: Binky Goes Nuts/Breezy Listening Blues
9.description: Binky learns he has a peanut allergy. He worries it will limit his life, and worse still, his mother is being way too overprotective. Meanwhile the Brain is pestered by the new corporate music his parents are playing in the ice cream shop.

10.title: Happy Anniversary
10.description: It's Mr. and Mrs. Read's anniversary, and Arthur and D.W. want to make it a special one. On the way to a romantic restaurant though, a sudden disaster ruins everything - or is there a chance to make it the best anniversary ever?

10.title: The Squirrels/Fern & Persimmony Glitchet
10.description: After watching the horror movie, "The Squirrels,"? Arthur is scared that squirrels are taking over the world. / Fern gets writing advice from Persimmony Glitchet, author of the book series, Horrendously Horrible Happenings

10.title: Desert Island Dish/The Secret About Secrets
10.description: When Arthur's class is assigned to find the perfect food for a desert island, they discover that they can't survive on junk food alone! / D.W. learns that getting a secret is easy, but keeping one is hard.

10.title: Feeling Flush/Family Fortune
10.description: Francine despairs when, despite conservation efforts, her family's water meter levels are higher than Arthur's. / Arthur and D.W. are convinced they'll find treasures that will make them rich on TV's "Treasure Caravan."

10.title: D.W. Aims High/Flaw & Order
10.description: D.W. discovers the excitement of space exploration when she decides she wants to be the first person on Mars. / Who broke Dad's cake platter? DUN-DUN! And what keeps making that mysterious yet familiar "DUN-DUN!" sound?

10.title: The Curse of the Grebes/Arthur Changes Gears
10.description: Major leaguers Johnny Damon, Mike Timlin, and Edgar Renteria guest star to help the Elwood City Grebes win the baseball championship. / Arthur learns that it's better to enjoy the bike of his dreams than to keep it on display.

10.title: Unfinished/D.W., Bossy Boots
10.description: The last pages are missing from the adventures of Dr. Gustavius Boles and Caleb Trimingham. Will Arthur have to make up his own ending? / For D.W., nothing's better than getting her own way--until her friends won't play with her.

10.title: Binky vs. Binky/Operation: D.W.!
10.description: Binky is tough--except when it comes to sports. But then he discovers that the only competitor he needs to beat is himself. / When D.W. needs an ear operation, she gets a first-hand view of how hospitals help kids get better.

10.title: Do You Speak George?/World Girls
10.description: George can't understand his classmates' made-up languages. Can he get them communicating together again?/World Girl World sells every doll! But Muffy, Sue Ellen, and Francine may need to make the ones they really want.

10.title: What's Cooking?/Buster's Special Delivery
10.description: Celebrity chef Ming Tsai is coming to judge Lakewood Elementary?s first ever cooking contest!/Buster volunteers to deliver the school mail and finds out that his new job is actually hard work! Will he crack under the pressure?

11.title: Swept Away/Germophobia
11.description: Arthur and the gang head to the beach for some fun building sandcastles. Meanwhile Buster develops an acute fear of germs and begins to isolate himself from his favorite things - including his friends.

11.title: Arthur Sells Out/Mind Your Manners
11.description: Timmy and Tommy miss Grandparents' Day and desire to do something nice for their grandmother, who is also their legal guardian. With some help from D.W. and Molly, they hope to improve their rambunctious manners.

11.title: Buenas noches, Vicita/Prunella Packs It In
11.description: Vicita Molina has lost her favorite book - a lovely South American tale of friendship and courage in the Amazon jungle. Everyone knows that elementary school is way too early to start thinking about college - except Prunella.

11.title: Phony Fern/Brain's Shocking Secret
11.description: Fern receives the latest phone for simple communication, but becomes addicted to the appliance. Meanwhile Brain was held back in kindergarten and doesn't want his friends to know about it.

11.title: Baby Kate and the Imaginary Mystery/Strangers on a Train
11.description: D.W. tells her friends that she's a fantastic skater. The truth is, with Emily's skating party coming up, she can barely stand on ice! Accused of being spoiled by her friends, Muffy sets about to prove them wrong.

11.title: The Making of Arthur/Dancing Fools
11.description: Matt Damon guest-stars in animated form as the host of a new series, "Postcards from You." When the Oscar-winning star puts out a call for homemade videos for his show, Arthur and the gang rush to film their lives. Mrs. Molina is teaching a dance class for kids, and it makes for some unlikely dance pairings - will anyone survive the class?

11.title: Hic or Treat/Mr. Alwaysright
11.description: Brain is always right and it's starting to get on Buster's nerves. He'll screw up eventually, and when he does, Buster will be waiting.

11.title: Francine's Pilfered Paper/Buster Gets Real
11.description: There's nothing wrong with that... is there? Everyone loves the new "Top Supermarket" reality series on TV - everyone except Arthur. So when Buster stops watching "Bionic Bunny" to watch this popular new show, Arthur fears their friendship is over.

11.title: D.W. on Ice/Spoiled Rotten
11.description: Accused of being spoiled by her friends, Muffy sets about to prove them wrong.

11.title: Big Brother Binky
11.description: Binky learns what it means to be an older brother, after his parents adopt a baby girl from China.

12.title: Is That Kosher?/Never Never Never
12.description: Francine fasts for Yom Kippur, but she also wants to go to Arthur's pizza party; DW has too many toys and needs to give some away.

12.title: Room to Ride/The Frensky Family Fiasco
12.description: Lance Armstrong makes a special trip to Elwood City in this episode about bicycling and good citizenship.

12.title: D.W.'s Stray Netkitin/Bats in the Belfry
12.description: D.W. is panicked when a "Scary Clown" virus ruins the Read family computer. Who will take care of her virtual Netkitin pet?

12.title: For the Birds/I Owe You One
12.description: Brain dreams of being the first to spot a rare bird species called the green-tailed grebe. When Mr. Ratburn starts a bird-watching club at school, Brain is panicked!

12.title: The Chronicles of Buster/On This Spot
12.description: Buster is obsessed with the extended DVD version of the epic film "The Chronicles of Ahmayzzia," with 1001 hours of behind-the-scenes footage!

12.title: The Cherry Tree/Matchmaker, Matchbreaker
12.description: Muffy's favorite tree is cut down; Muffy and Francine try to hook Muffy's brother up with Francine's sister.

12.title: War of the Worms/Ungifted
12.description: Brain is always taking the fun out of Fern's storytelling by correcting her facts. She decides to teach him a lesson by spinning a tall tale that he can't help but believe.

12.title: The Blackout/Mei Lin Takes a Stand
12.description: A summer heatwave leads to a city wide power outage.; Binky's adopted sister, Mei Lin learns to stand with help from Kate, Pal, and Amigo the flea.

12.title: Home Sweet Home/Do You Believe in Magic
12.description: Buster heads off to summer camp reluctantly, worried that he won't know anyone.

12.title: The Perfect Game/D.W.'s Furry Freakout
12.description: Francine is excited for Mr. Ratburn's coolest assignment yet - he's asked them to design their very own model cities!

13.title: No Acting Please/Prunella Deegan and the Disappointing Ending
13.description: Actor Philip Seymour Hoffman guest-stars as director Will Toffman in this episode about theater and the arts.

13.title: Kung Fool/The Silent Treatment
13.description: When quiet, shy George wonders if any of his friends really notice him, he has a great idea. He's not going to speak to anyone until they notice!

13.title: Arthur's Number Nightmare/Brain Gets Hooked
13.description: When Arthur and friends discover what looks like a list of their class rankings in Principal Haney's office, they are all taken for a surprise.

13.title: MacFrensky/The Good, the Bad and the Binky
13.description: When Francine and Brain are locked in a stiff competition to win student of the month, Muffy talks Francine into "borrowing" Buster's toy and letting Brain take the blame for it.

13.title: The Great MacGrady
13.description: When Mrs. McGrady is diagnosed with cancer, Arthur and his friends all act differently to the news.

13.title: D.W. Swims with the Fishes/When Carl Met George
13.description: The Tibble Twins set out on new business venture - selling their pre-school art masterpieces to earn enough money to buy the coveted Krummy Kreepy Kastle.

13.title: Paradise Lost/George and the Missing Puzzle Piece
13.description: Kate says her first word and begins to lose her ability to talk to Pal. George befriends a boy on the Autistic Spectrum.

13.title: The Secret Guardians/Prunella and the Haunted Locker
13.description: As part of her latest business venture, Muffy talks Fern into writing poems for a new line of greeting cards which becomes the hit of Elwood City.

13.title: The Secret Origin of Supernova/Fernlets by Fern
13.description: Famous rock musician Dean Lomax visits Elwood City and calls on George's dad to fix his equally famous guitar, named Bonnie.

13.title: Looking for Bonnie/The Pride of Lakewood
13.description: A famous rock star asks George's father to fix his "magic" guitar. The kids start a "school pride" club which soon gets out of hand.

14.title: The Wheel Deal/The Buster Report
14.description: Due to an injury, the Brain is temporarily in a wheelchair and is worried he can't play basketball, but with the help of Lydia, a student who plays wheelchair basketball, she shows him how a limitation can be an advantage.

14.title: The Agent of Change/D.W. Unties the Knot
14.description: The latest animated hit in movie theaters about a boy and his truck has left Muffy and Francine disappointed. Why doesn't there seem to be any cool female characters on screen?

14.title: Nicked by a Name/Play's the Thing
14.description: There is a virus spreading through Lakewood Elementary! It changes the way everyone acts and how they treat each other....it's the new nicknames! Can Brain stop the virus he created or will everyone be mean to each other forever?

14.title: Falafelosophy/The Great Lint Rush
14.description: At the urging of guest-star author Neil Gaiman ("Coraline," "The Graveyard Book") Sue Ellen tries her hand at writing and illustrating a graphic novel. When Sue Ellen needs inspiration and encouragement, she turns to Neil

14.title: Tales of Grotesquely Grim Bunny/Pet Projects
14.description: When the local comic book store changes ownership, the new darker and scarier comics are right up Fern's alley. But Arthur can't seem to stomach them and now he's worried. Is it wrong to be afraid?

14.title: Follow the Bouncing Ball/Buster Baxter & the Letter from the Sea
14.description: Alberto loses his favorite soccer ball, but will a strange series of events help it get back home to him?

14.title: Around the World in 11 Minutes/Muffy and the Big Bad Blog
14.description: Kate, Mei-Lin, Pal and Amigo take an imaginary trip around the world. Muffy starts her own blog, but it soon gets out of hand when she starts gossiping about her schoolmates.

14.title: Arthur Unravels/All the Rage
14.description: Arthur finds a new passion in knitting, but fears that the school bullies will treat him as a sissy because of the stereotype that knitting is for old ladies. Can he still enjoy his new hobby?

14.title: D.W., Queen of the Comeback/In My Africa
14.description: The Tibbles tease, D.W. fires back, the Tibbles taunt, D.W. has a snappy comeback, and round and round they go! Will it ever end? Perhaps an ancient Indian fable about a turtle and two wisecracking geese will be enough to teach D.W. to just let it go.

14.title: Buster Spaces Out/The Long Road Home
14.description: Buster becomes fixated on the moon landing and wants to design his very own rocket, but his friends can't agree on how to do it. With the help of a special guest, can Buster achieve his dream?

15.title: Fifteen
15.description: Arthur and the gang each see what kinds of cool things they can get done in fifteen minutes, and some amazing adventures ensue.

15.title: I Wanna Hold Your Hand/Whistling in the Wind
15.description: Binky worries that everybody will treat him like a baby if they they find out he still holds his mother's hand in public. The Tibble Twins have a falling out after Tommy discovers he can whistle loudly and Timmy cannot.

15.title: Buster's Secret Admirer/The Last King of Lambland
15.description: Buster gets a mysterious box of chocolates and tries to track down who the gift came from. Meanwhile James gets a new toy lamb from his uncle and wonders if it contains special powers.

15.title: Cents-Less/Buster the Lounge Lizard
15.description: Mr. Ratburn sets up a week-long experiment where nobody in class can spend any money. Meanwhile Buster purchases a new Dark Bunny toy that seems to have a mind of its own.

15.title: To Eat or Not to Eat/S.W.E.A.T.
15.description: Buster begins to wonder about the strange chemicals in a trendy new candy bar for sale. Meanwhile Arthur and the gang worry about how to pass their first standardized tests.

15.title: What's in a Name?/Prunella the Packrat
15.description: Binky is embarrassed to learn that his real name is Shelly, but then he learns the cool history behind it. Meanwhile Arthur and Rubella try to help Prunella break her hoarding habit.

15.title: Muffy's Classy Classics Club/Best Enemies
15.description: Muffy gets Bailey to help her set up a book club for her favorite doll-themed series, but finds that her friends have their own personal tastes. Meanwhile D.W. tries to befriend a new girl her age, with hilarious results.

15.title: Buster's Garden of Grief/Through the Looking Glasses
15.description: Buster runs into trouble while agreeing to watch over his friend Fritz's community garden. Meanwhile Arthur gets new hipster glasses to replace his old ones, giving him a huge and annoying ego.

15.title: Trouble with Trophies/The Butler Did... What?
15.description: Bailey goes missing, and Muffy realizes to her regret that she never really treated him like a dear friend. Meanwhile Fern is bothered for not wanting a trophy.

15.title: Grandpa Dave's Memory Album/Buster's Carpool Catastrophe
15.description: Arthur and D.W. get worried when Grandpa Dave begins to forget everything, but he assures them that this is common with older people. Meanwhile Buster has to carpool with friends.

16.title: Based on a True Story: Part 1/Based on a True Story: Part II
16.description: From PBS KIDS! There's a new kid in town: Ladonna Compson, the Louisiana native with the gift of gab.

16.title: Flippity Francine/Muffy Takes the Wheel
16.description: From PBS KIDS! When Muffy posts a goofy video of Francine on the Muffington Post, Francine worries she will become the laughing stock of the entire school. Can Francine regain her dignity?

16.title: Blockheads/All About D.W.
16.description: From PBS KIDS! When Emily gets the starring role in the preschool play, D.W. is beside herself with jealousy. She should be Little Red Riding Hood, not Tree #2!

16.title: Get Smart/Baby Steps
16.description: From PBS KIDS! Everyone loves HUGO-the new interactive whiteboard that claims to be 100% accurate. If only Mr. Ratburn knew how to use it!

16.title: Night of the Tibble/Read and Flumbergast
16.description: From PBS KIDS! The Tibble Twins are having their first sleepover! The lucky victim - err, guest: James.

16.title: The Last Tough Customer/Brain's Chess Mess
16.description: From PBS KIDS! The Tough Customers realize it's time to quit bullying and set out to find a new hobby - but can Molly ever truly change her ways?

16.title: Baseball Blues/Brain's Biggest Blunder
16.description: From PBS KIDS! It's Grebelings season and George can't wait to play!

16.title: Buster's Book Battle/On the Buster Scale
16.description: From PBS KIDS! Buster's Book Battle - Lakewood Elementary has just instituted IRP; a program where kids can earn points (and prizes!) for reading. Buster's thrilled and gets to work straight away! But will he earn enough points for a skateboard?/On the Buster Scale - Buster and Brain never agree on movies. Buster rates every film a 10+, while Brain doesn't seem to like anything. Only one of them can be right - or so they think.

16.title: Fern and the Case of the Stolen Story/Sue Ellen Vegges Out
16.description: From PBS KIDS! The unthinkable has happened! Fern has writer's block!

16.title: So Funny I Forgot to Laugh/The Best Day Ever
16.description: From PBS KIDS! Arthur thinks his jokes about Sue Ellen's new sweater are all in good fun but Sue Ellen's feelings are hurt. Has Arthur become a bully?

17.title: Show Off/Dog's Best Friend
17.description: Can Pal win a dog show against a snooty poodle? Meanwhile, when Arthur agrees to watch the neighbor's dog, Amigo, Pal fears he's no longer Arthur's favorite pet anymore.

17.title: Adventures in Budylon/Ladonna Compson: Party Animal
17.description: LaDonna's determined to participate in as many autumn activities as possible, but has she taken on too much work to handle? Suddenly she finds herself strapped for time and all her friends are upset.

17.title: Molina's Mulligan/Buster Bombs
17.description: Alberto has a golf match with Chip at the country club, but he fears that his overzealous father may humiliate him. Meanwhile Buster is horrified when his friends stop finding him funny.

17.title: Opposites Distract/Just the Ticket
17.description: Arthur and Buster learn how to handle a cramped living situation. Meanwhile, Arthur's friends keep pestering him about the tickets he's won. With a little help from Muffy's butler, Bailey, can Arthur make them stop?

17.title: All Thumbs/Kidonia
17.description: Arthur accidentally discovers that Buster still sucks his thumb, and he's disgusted by it. Can Buster trust him to keep it a secret? Meanwhile Arthur and the gang invent their own secret rule-free society.

17.title: Speak Up, Francine!/Waiting for Snow
17.description: Francine tries to voice her opinions about pesticide runoff polluting her favorite creek. Meanwhile Arthur and Buster try to get LaDonna's first snow day off to a great start.

17.title: Pets and Pests/Go Fly a Kite
17.description: D.W. enlists the help of Nemo to get a rat out of her house, but the rat is actually very friendly. Meanwhile Muffy, Bailey, LaDonna and Binky discover a kite but Muffy has trouble sharing it.

17.title: The Director's Cut/Crime and Consequences
17.description: George is inspired to make his own movie, but has trouble choosing a director to help him. Meanwhile, after George smashes a woodworking project, Binky is blamed. Will George let Binky take the fall, or come clean?

17.title: Caught in the Crosswires/Framed!
17.description: Muffy is thrilled to have a reality TV show filming her life, but when she has to be cruel to Bailey to heighten the drama, she worries it's going too far. Buster learns how to deal with picky people when he's asked to do Muffy's portrait.

17.title: Binky's Music Madness/Brain Freeze
17.description: Binky discovers ambient music and isn't sure what to think of it. Meanwhile a trendy new ice cream shop has opened up, and it's threatening to put the Brain's shop out of business. Can he save the shop or is it too late?

18.title: The Friend Who Wasn't There/Surprise!
18.description: Muffy gets Bailey to help her recover nostalgic memories of her childhood imaginary friend. Meanwhile Francine has been uninvited to Catherine's sweet sixteen, and decides to get a little birthday revenge.

18.title: The Case of the Girl with the Long Face/The Substitute Arthur
18.description: Fern seems depressed lately, but nobody can figure out why. Can amateur detective Buster Baxter help solve the mystery of what's got her down in the dumps?

18.title: The Tattletale Frog/D.W. & Bud's Higher Purpose
18.description: Bud and DW try to be tall so they can go on a ride at the theme park.

18.title: Best Wishes/The Tardy Tumbler
18.description: George has a lucky streak, but how long will it last, and can he really rely on it? Meanwhile Prunella goes into gymnastics for Marina's sake, but the rigorous training program has her wanting to give up.

18.title: Fountain Abbey/Arthur Calls It
18.description: Muffy is devastated to learn that her family history is one of poverty and manual labor, but with some help from her friends, especially Binky, can she learn to appreciate her heritage?

18.title: Two Minutes/Messy Dress Mess
18.description: Muffy loans LaDonna a beautiful recital dress, but when LaDonna damages it, how can she break the news to Muffy? Will she be expected to replace it?

18.title: Francine's Cleats of Strength/Little Miss Meanie
18.description: Francine takes on a job as Muffy's personal assistant to earn the money for a pricey pair of cleats. However, she finds herself relying on Bailey to do all the work, and isn't sure she's really paying her own way for what she wants.

18.title: Whip. Mix. Blend/Staycation
18.description: Rattles finds that things are getting confusing when his mom starts dating a new guy, Archie. Rattles has nothing in common with Archie's kids, but can he still find joy in this new family unit?

18.title: Shelter from the Storm: Part 1 and Part 2
18.description: Arthur and the gang cope with a dangerous hurricane. Muffy has to put up with shelter life, LaDonna's father has to aid in disaster relief, Arthur worries for stranded pets and the Brain learns to overcome trauma.

18.title: Arthur Read: Super Saver/Tibbles to the Rescue
18.description: Business is slow for Mr. and Mrs. Read, and Arthur is concerned. Can this "super saver" find ways to keep his family in the green?/ When D.W. saves Tommy and Timmy from a nasty fall, they decide to repay the favor...whether D.W. likes it or not.

18.title: The Pageant Pickle/Some Assembly Required
18.description: School is almost out and Arthur can hardly wait for those lazy summer days by Muffy's pool. Nothing could ruin such a happy time of year... except maybe-D.W.'s Spring Pageant!/ D.W. can't wait to test out her new play set! But while it's being built she'll have to settle for the box. With the help of Bud and Emily, D.W. realizes her imagination is way better than any toy!

19.title: Brain's Brain/Brain Sees Stars
19.description: A) Brain, D.W and Bud venture into Brain's brain after neither can remember where they can find the last Easter Egg in the Easter Egg Hunt. B) Brain plans on seeing a meteor shower but thinks he is cursed since every year something goes wrong and cannot see it. This year, he makes amends and finally sees it.

19.title: Sue Ellen Adds It Up/Wish You Were Here
19.description: Sue-Ellen has made a zoo animal painting, but trying to fit it on the wall of the school using math skills frustrates her. Meanwhile, her pen pal Tenzin comes to visit, but is she not listening to what his interests are?

19.title: Arthur's Toy Trouble/Spar for the Course
19.description: Arthur learns that his defective monster nerd toy may be valuable, but is this knowledge of money ruining his chances of having fun with the toy? Meanwhile the gang try to design a new golf hole for their mini-putt course.

19.title: Buster's Not Buying It/One Ornery Critter
19.description: Aliens, conspiracy theories, the megatoad...Buster believes in everything! That is until his favorite show gets cancelled for false reporting. Now the new Buster isn't buying anything! Can Arthur and friends convince him to have a little faith? Educational Objective: Mr. Morris reminds Buster that the world's more interesting when there's a little mystery in it. / Dogs love Arthur! Well, all except Carrot Cake...Can Arthur win over this picky pup, or will he walk away with his tail between his legs?

19.title: Maria Speaks/Postcards from Binky
19.description: Maria has always been mute in Arthur's class, but it's because she has a speech impediment. With some encouragement from her friends and Mr. Ratburn, can Maria get the chance to speak out?

19.title: Carl's Concerto/Too Much of a Good Thing
19.description: George wants Carl to help him work on a puppet show, but Carl's autistic routines are hindering his efforts. Can George learn to respect Carl's differences and still give him the opportunity to participate?

19.title: Carried Away/ Dueling Detectives!
19.description: Kate and Mei Lin are thrilled to tour the solar system with Pal's cousin, Dr. Yowl. But Pal suspects his Plutonian relative is up to no good. Educational Objective: Kate and Mei Lin learn about the solar system. / Wally is missing and Elwood City's best detective is on the case. And that detective is...Binky?!? Not if Fern (aka Detective Virgule Watteau) has anything to say about it!

19.title: Mr. Ratburn's Secret Identity/Besties
19.description: Mysterious calls. Superhuman strength. Is Mr. Ratburn secretly a superhero? The kids search for the truth behind the Man in Green. Educational Objective: Arthur and friends learn not to jump to conclusions. / When Buster and Ladonna bond over a memorable trip to the movies, Arthur feels left out. Has Ladonna taken his place as Buster's best bud?

19.title: The Last Day
19.description: It's a time of change at Lakewood Elementary. Arthur and Buster are going into 4th grade (and will do anything to get the cool new teacher, MC-voiced by special guest B.J. Novak). Meanwhile, D.W. and Bud prepare to enter kindergarten and Muffy and Francine contemplate how spending the summer away from each other will affect their friendship.

20.title: Buster's Second Chance/Arthur and the Whole Truth
20.description: Buster's Second Chance-With the help of a little time travel, Buster turns back the clock to see what his life would be as a genius. But will a life winning science competitions mean a life without Arthur? Arthur and the Whole- Arthur isn't happy when he discovers that Buster has been telling him some white lies, even if it was just to spare his feelings.

20.title: Fern's Flights of Fancy/Cereal
20.description: Fern enters a contest and loses, DW's class bunny escapes.

20.title: He Said, He Said/Bunny Trouble
20.description: A new Bionic Bunny special edition is airing on TV, D.W babysits the class bunny, Larry. But Larry goes missing.

20.title: That's My Grandma/Bud's Knotty Problem
20.description: Bud's Knotty Problem- When Bud falls in love with a snazzy new pair of boots, he might face his toughest adventure yet - learning to tie his shoes. / That's MY Grandma- D.W. gets jealous when Grandma Thora becomes the most popular babysitter in town.

20.title: Lend Me Your Ear/The Butler Did It
20.description: Muffy buys a robotic butler for her father but then fears that Bailey, who isn't just the family butler but also her best friend, will be replaced. Meanwhile Arthur and the gang notice that Mr. Ratburn is acting very strangely.

20.title: Prunella's Tent of Portent/Mutiny on the Pitch
20.description: Prunella's Tent of Portent- At the Elwood City Picnic, Prunella pretends she can see the future at her fortune telling booth. But her best friend, Marina, doubts her mystical powers. / Mutiny on the Pitch- The Lakewood Elementary soccer team has had enough of Francine's bossy behavior. To show the team how much they need her, Francine gives up her post to the most unlikely teammate...Buster!

20.title: The Hallway Minotaur/Ladonna's Like List
20.description: The Hallway Minotaur- Attention Lakewood Elementary! There's a new sheriff-er, hallway monitor-in town, and his name is George Lundgren./ Ladonna's Like List- Ladonna Compson is friendly, funny, and full of personality. Everyone likes her! At least, that's what she thought...

21.title: Binky's 'A' Game/Brain and the Time Capsule
21.description: Binky's 'A' Game / Brain and the Time Capsule- When Binky gets an "A" on a test, Muffy and Francine are convinced he cheated. Then Brain makes a time capsule and gets overwhelmed by people asking to have their special belongings included. Will he make room for his friends?

21.title: The Master Builders
21.description: The Master Builders, Parts 1 and 2- Buster struggles to build a birdhouse that will save the community garden from pests, while Muffy and Francine design a cat toy that they think will really change the pet toy game.

21.title: Francine and the Soccer Spy/Sue Ellen & the Last Page
21.description: Francine and the Soccer Spy / Sue Ellen and the Last Page- When Ladonna befriends a new member of the soccer team, Francine becomes convinced she is leaking secret team info. The City Council has voted to close the Elwood City Library! Can Sue Ellen save the library before it's too late?

21.title: Muffy Misses Out; Arthur Takes a Stand
21.description: Muffy worries that her friends don't need her anymore when they plan a bake sale without her; and Arthur thinks Mrs. MacGrady is being treated unfairly, so seeks guidance from Congressman John Lewis.

21.title: Take a Hike, Molly/Slink's Special Talent
21.description: Molly wants the Tough Customers to go hiking with her to see a really cool place she discovered, but when she's rude to them, she can't seem to apologize. Can Binky help her learn to say sorry properly?

21.title: The Lost Dinosaur/The Princess Problem
21.description: Bud's imaginary friend, Rapty the dinosaur, is missing; and, with the help of Arthur's friend Lydia, D.W. discovers the true qualities of a princess.

21.title: Invasion of the Soccer Fans/Pal and the Big Itch
21.description: Kate appears to be hypnotized by the soccer game on the television! Can Pal, Amigo, and Killer snap her out of her trance? When Pal has to wear a cone, he takes advantage of his friends' kindness, but the decision comes back to bite him.

22.title: Mr. Ratburn and the Special Someone/The Feud
22.description: Mr. Ratburn is getting married! Arthur can't believe it. Teachers don't have lives outside of school...do they? And Arthur and Buster get into an argument over a video game and pretty soon the entire third grade class chooses sides.

22.title: When Rivals Came to Roost/The Longest Eleven Minutes
22.description: Brain is upset over Mighty Mountain School stealing their worms; The internet is not working.

22.title: Muffy's House Guests/Binky Can't Always Get What He Wants
22.description: "Muffy's House Guests": Muffy is terrified when peregrine falcons build a nest outside her bedroom window. "Binky Can't Always Get What He Wants": Binky must choose between starring in a television commercial or performing in a talent show.

22.title: Muffy's Car Campaign/Truth or Poll
22.description: Francine rallies the troops around a petition to help Lakewood Elementary protect the environment. Binky is convinced Mr. Ratburn's math test was too hard, so Brain suggests he conduct a poll to find out what the rest of the class thinks.

22.title: Deep In My Heart/Recovery: Substitute Teacher
22.description: Ratburn can't make it to school, so Arthur and his friends have a new teacher.

23.title: Fright Night; Citizen Cheikh
23.description: Buster's Uncle Bob tells him a spooky bedtime story about an encounter with a mysterious creature called the lycanbunny; Cheikh is worried that if he and his family become American citizens, then they will have to abandon their Senegalese culture.

23.title: The Pea and the Princess; D.W. and Dr. Whosit
23.description: Prunella is directing the third-grade's production of "The Princess and the Pea," but nothing seems to go according to her plan; D.W. is determined to watch a new television show after her parents tell her she's too young to watch.

23.title: When Duty Calls, Parts 1 & 2
23.description: Fern and the others try to make an upset Ladonna feel better after she finds out her family will have to move.

23.title: An Arthur Thanksgiving
23.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

24.title: The Great MacGrady
24.description: When Mrs. McGrady is diagnosed with cancer, Arthur and his friends all act differently to the news.

24.title: D.W.'s New Best Friend/Freaky Tuesday
24.description: D.W. ditches Emily just to be friends with the new cool kid; Arthur has a series of nightmares.

24.title: George Scraps His Sculpture/Arthur's Big Meltdown
24.description: George destroys his sculpture. Then he breaks out into a temper tantrum and starts bullying others.

25.title: Binky Wrestles with a Story/All Will Be Revealed
25.description: Binky imagines like he's wrestling for real./Something will be revealed.

25.title: Making Conversation/A Cloudy Day
25.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

25.title: Listen Up/Arthur's New Old Vacation
25.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

25.title: Blabbermouth/All Grown Up
25.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Auditions #1
1.description: The contestants have one hour to cook one dish.

1.title: Auditions #2
1.description: The contestants have one hour to cook one dish.

1.title: Top 14 Revealed
1.description: The contestants take 2 basic skills tests: 1st to chop onions and continue until judges tells them to stop, the judges dissect the chopped onions, if they don't meet the judge's standards, they are eliminated.The 2nd was to cook one egg any style using any ingredients in 30 minutes.

1.title: 14 Chefs Compete
1.description: For their first mystery box challenge the contestants had 45 minutes to create a dish using a double cut pork chop with other ingredients.

1.title: Top 11 Compete
1.description: For their first team challenge, the contestants cook for one hundred marines and their families.

1.title: Top 9 Compete
1.description: The contestants were given ingredients to make one cupcake.

1.title: Top 6 Compete
1.description: The contestants cook hamburgers for 100 truck drivers.

1.title: Winner Revealed
1.description: The contestants were given sixty minutes to prepare a dish using a live Dungeness crab.

1.title: Top 6 Compete, Part 2
1.description: In their first individual challenge, the contestants are required to cook fresh Sculpin fish for professional food critics Jeffrey Steingarten, Tanya Steel, and Barbara Fairchild.

2.title: Auditions #1
2.description: Masterchef hopefuls will prepare their signature dishes and present them to judges Gordon Ramsay, Joe Bastianich and Graham Elliot. The amateur cooks will be put through the paces, and only the most deserving will win a white apron and move on to the next round of the competition.

2.title: Audition #2
2.description: Nerves are tested as the judges continue to winnow down the Top 100 in their search for the America's best amateur cook.

2.title: Top 38 Revealed
2.description: The auditions continue and as usual the contestants have five minutes to cook their signature dishes in front of the judges. Once they receive at least two votes from the three judges, they receive a white apron.

2.title: Elimination Round
2.description: The top 18 contestants are revealed.

2.title: Top 16 Revealed
2.description: For their first mystery box challenge the contestants had sixty minutes to create a dish with salmon as the main ingredient as well as other ingredients as well.

2.title: Top 16 Compete
2.description: The contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook for five-course meal which consisted of a soup, a salad, pizza, a special entrée and a dessert for three hundred and fifty office workers.

2.title: Top 15 Compete
2.description: The contestants had sixty to create a dish consisting of a rack of New Zealand lamb and other ingredients.

2.title: Top 14 Compete
2.description: For their next team challenge The contestants were split into 2 teams and had to cook a sausage sandwich for 101 bikers then the bikers would vote and the first team to receive 51 votes would win.

2.title: Top 13 Compete
2.description: Season one winner Whitney Miller returned to present her new cookbook.

2.title: Top 12 Compete
2.description: The contestants were brought to Ramsay's restaurant, The London West Hollywood hotel to cater for Hollywood party. The contestants were required to make 3 different Hors d oeuvres, a beef, vegetable and desert.

2.title: Top 11 Compete
2.description: For their 4th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had to cook fresh lobster.

2.title: Top 10 Compete
2.description: The contestants were divided into two teams and were required to cook a three course meal for the judge's mothers. The captain for each team spent 2 minutes with the mothers to find out what kind of foods the mothers like and dislike.

2.title: Mystery Box Challenge 5
2.description: For their fifth Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had to cook a dish using three hand-dived scallops and other ingredients.

2.title: Top 8 Compete
2.description: The contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook a slider and a side dish for a children's block party without using beef or potatoes.

2.title: Top 8 Compete Again
2.description: Surf and Turf was the theme for the contestant's 6th Mystery Box Challenge. The Mystery Box consisted of live jumbo shrimp, Alaskan king crab, live craw fish, buffalo rib eye, porterhouse steak, and short ribs.

2.title: Top 6 Compete
2.description: The remaining six contestants were divided into two teams at Patina restaurant and for one dinner service they had to replicate two signature appetizers and two signature entrées from the restaurant's menu.

2.title: Top 5 Compete
2.description: The top five contestants had to create a dish using ground pork, ground veal, ground beef, and other ingredients.

2.title: Top 4 Compete
2.description: The top four contestants had cook six portions of the same dish for the three judges of the American version of MasterChef and three guest judges from MasterChef India, MasterChef France, and MasterChef Israel.

2.title: Top 3 Compete
2.description: final three contestants were required to cook a dish using chicken with other ingredients using any style and any technique in one hour.

2.title: Winner Revealed
2.description: For the finale Adrien and Jennifer had two hours to cook an appetizer, an entrée, and desert using any ingredients they preferred and cook in any style and any technique.

3.title: Auditions #1
3.description: The search begins for America's best amateur cook.

3.title: Auditions 2
3.description: The search continues for America's best amateur cook.

3.title: Top 36 Become 18
3.description: The remaining hopefuls compete for a spot in the top 18.

3.title: Top 18
3.description: The top 18 are forced out of their comfort zone.

3.title: Top 16
3.description: For the first team challenge, the remaining 16 contestants were divided into two teams and were required to cook an entrée for 201 Marines. After tasting both entrées each Marine would vote and the team with the most votes would win the team challenge.

3.title: Top 15
3.description: Guts are tested as the remaining fifteen contestants are challenged to create a unique dish using unconventional - and unappetizing - cuts of meat. The contestants who are most resourceful and think outside the box will make the cut and continue to the next round.

3.title: Top 14
3.description: The judges plan a surprise trip for the amateur cooks, but the contestants are in for a rude awakening when the judges split them into teams to prepare hearty breakfast meals for hungry hotel guests. The teams must be organized and work efficiently, but tempers reach a new high during room service. Later, the losing team must prove they deserve to remain in the competition in an emotional elimination round.

3.title: Top 13
3.description: For their third Mystery Box Challenge the contestants had to cook a T-bone steak with other ingredients.

3.title: Top 12
3.description: Team challenge: split into 3 teams, each with a food truck serving a different style of food, to sell to visitors at Venice Bench. Earn the most to win.

3.title: Top 11
3.description: Graham Elliot takes on the mystery box.

3.title: Top 9
3.description: For their 5th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had 60 minutes to create a dish using a live sea urchin, also known as uni. But first Ramsey showed the contestants had to humanely remove the sea urchin from it's shell.

3.title: Top 8
3.description: For their 4th team challenge the contestants had to cook steak and two side dishes for 101 cowboys and cowgirls.

3.title: Top 7
3.description: A guest judge surprises the contestants with a letter from their loved ones and were required to cook with southern ingredients.

3.title: The Return
3.description: The eliminated contestants return to compete for a "second chance" white apron.

3.title: The New Top 7
3.description: The final seven contestants had 45 minutes to create a dish using live Santa Barbara spot prawns.

3.title: The Top 6
3.description: For their 5th team challenge the contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook one dinner service at Hatfield's restaurant.

3.title: Top 5 Battle to Survive
3.description: The remaining five home cooks select the mystery box ingredients they will need to create a dish that best represents who they are, but the judges surprise the contestants with a game changing twist. Later, in the elimination challenge, the home cooks will have a limited amount of time to conceptualize and recreate one of Graham Elliot's signature dishes that he served to President Barack Obama at his flagship restaurant. Find out whose dish is fit to impress the Commander-in-Chief and who will be sent home.

3.title: The Final 4
3.description: In the most intimidating challenge of the season, the final four home cooks will split into two teams to prepare an exquisite three-course meal for the judges and three world-renowned chefs: Daniel Boulud, Alain Ducasse and Guy Savoy. The Michelin-starred guest judges will help critique each course and evaluate each dish's flavor, originality and culinary finesse. The winning pair will earn a spot in the Top 3, while the losing team will compete head-to-head in a heated pressure test featuring souffle. Find out who will rise to the occasion and who will collapse under...

3.title: The Top 3
3.description: The last Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants were allowed to cook a dish they can include if they were given the opportunity to publish their own cookbook. They can use any ingredients, cook in any style use any technique they preferred.

3.title: The Finale
3.description: THE JUDGES REVEAL AMERICA'S NEXT "MASTERCHEF" ON THE SEASON FINALE OF "MASTERCHEF." The Top Two finalists have one last chance to prove to the judges that they have the passion, skill and drive worthy of the MASTERCHEF title. In their final challenge in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the two home cooks will conceptualize and prepare the most important three-course meal of their lives.

4.title: Auditions #1
4.description: Each contestant is given 5 minutes to prepare, cook, and present their signature dish to the three judges. If they receive at least 2 yes' from the 3 judges they can advance to the next stage of the competition.

4.title: Auditions # 2
4.description: The auditions continue where each contestant is given 5 minutes to cook and present their dish in front of and to the judges. If they receive at least two yes's from the three judges, they can advance to the next stage of the competition.

4.title: Auditions #3: Top 19 Revealed
4.description: Find out which hopefuls make it into the "MasterChef" kitchen.

4.title: Top 19 Compete
4.description: Find out which hopefuls make it into the "MasterChef" kitchen.

4.title: Top 18 Compete
4.description: For their first team challenge the contestants had one hour and forty five minutes to cook one entrée and one desert for three hundred elementary school students.

4.title: Top 17 Compete
4.description: For their sixth Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants cook with Gordon Ramsay, but not competing against him.

4.title: Top 16 Compete: Part 1
4.description: The contestants feed American heroes.

4.title: Top 16 Compete: Part 2
4.description: The contestants take on Sin City.

4.title: Top 15 Chefs Compete
4.description: The home cooks face a tough pasta critic.

4.title: Top 14 Compete
4.description: The contestants face another team challenge as they prepare three dishes for the cast and crew of Glee.

4.title: Top 13 Compete
4.description: The contestants had ninety minutes to cook a dish with parts from a pig's head specifically the ears tongue, cheek, snout using other ingredients from the pantry and cook in any style and using any technique they preferred.

4.title: Top 12 Compete
4.description: In the next team challenge, the remaining contestants cooked for a wedding reception where they cooked the entrée and Graham cooked the appetizer and Gordon cooked the desert. The menu was created from the likes and dislikes of the bride and groom. The judges would determine which two members of the losing team would compete in the Pressure Test which was to make a dozen Macarons.

4.title: Top 11 Compete
4.description: A celebrity guest judge created a Mystery Box filled with ingredients from Mexico. They had sixty minutes to create a dish using only these ingredients.

4.title: Top 10 Compete
4.description: For their next team challenge the contestants cooked fish tacos for one hundred and one suffers at Huntington Beach, California.

4.title: Top 9 Compete
4.description: The remaining nine contestants had ninety minutes to make a sausage dish from scratch using a meat grinder.

4.title: Top 8 Compete
4.description: The Top 8 chefs are taken to a remote field for an overnight challenge in which they must cook for sustenance and create lunch for the judges using limited ingredients. Later, the losing team competes in a spun-sugar-dessert pressure test.

4.title: Top 7 Compete
4.description: The Top 7 chefs compete in a mystery-box challenge in which they create dishes inspired by their loved ones. Later, an elimination round featuring a tag-team sushi challenge takes place.

4.title: One Chef Wins Right to Return
4.description: The previously eliminated contestants were given a second chance to win back their white apron.

4.title: Top 7 Compete (+ 1 Returnee)
4.description: The contestants were required to cook a T bone steak in forty five minutes using any technique and cook in any style they preferred.

4.title: Top 6 Compete
4.description: The remaining six contestants cooked one dinner service at WP24,an Asian inspired restaurant which the dinner service included two appetizers and two entrées.

4.title: Top 5 Compete: Part 1
4.description: The judges' invited their sons to create a mystery box consisting of fifteen items. The contestants then had sixty minutes to create a restaurant worthy dish using these items and items in a limited pantry.

4.title: Top 5 Compete: Part 2
4.description: The remaining 5 contestants had to cook 50 portions for a charity lunch hosted by guest judge Paula Deen. The dish consisted of 1 protein and 2 sides. Deen would select the top 2 dishes and those two would be safe from the Pressure Test.

4.title: Top 4 Compete
4.description: The four contestants were divided into two teams and had two mystery boxes containing fifty ingredients each and were required to make a three course menu consisting of an appetizer, entreé and dessert.

4.title: The Semi-Final
4.description: The remaining three contestants were given the same exact ingredients they used to create the dish they cooked and presented for their first audition.

4.title: Winner Chosen
4.description: For the finale the contestants had to cook a three course meal, one hour for each course.The decision was close enough where the judges were considering a draw.

5.title: Top 30 Compete
5.description: Host award-winning chef Gordon Ramsay, along with fellow judges restaurateur Joe Bastianich and acclaimed chef Graham Elliot return for Season Five, putting the latest group of contestants through a series of challenging elimination rounds and turning one home cook into a culinary master.

5.title: Top 22 Compete
5.description: In the first mystery box challenge of the season, the Top Finalists will have 90 minutes to prep and cook a unique and impressive dish, using mainly dessert ingredients. The winner of the mystery box will have a significant advantage in the next round, deciding which classic American dish the remaining contestants will have to prepare in the elimination round. Find out who will rise to the occasion and whose dream of becoming America's next MASTERCHEF will come to an end.

5.title: Top 20 Compete
5.description: It's the ultimate culinary war when the remaining 20 home cooks compete in the biggest field challenge in MASTERCHEF history: feeding an army of 500 servicemen and women on a desert army base. In their first team challenge, the contestants will split into two teams - the red team and the blue team - to create a hearty meal including one protein and two side dishes. Tempers flare as both teams struggle with consistency, and every dish counts as the troops will vote for their favorite dish and determine the winning team. Later, the losing team will face an intense ...

5.title: Top 18 Compete
5.description: For their second Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had sixty minutes to create a dish with live seafood.

5.title: Top 17 Compete
5.description: For their 2nd team challenge the contestants were divided into two teams and had two hours to cook for 120 wedding guests.

5.title: Top 16 Compete
5.description: The 3rd Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants were given 52 unlabeled aluminum and tin cans, and a limited pantry. They can use any amount of cans they preferred, in 60 minutes to create a restaurant quality dish.

5.title: Top 15 Compete
5.description: For the 3rd team challenge, for 1 hour the contestants worked in pairs cook with seafood and red meat. The teams with the worst dishes would compete in the Pressure Test.

5.title: Top 14 Compete
5.description: The Restaurant Takeover took place at Dinah's Family Restaurant in Culver City, California.

5.title: Top 13 Compete
5.description: Thirteen chefs compete in a mystery-box challenge involving wild Alaskan king salmon. In the second round, the home cooks create dishes using a judge's favorite ingredients.

5.title: Top 12 Compete
5.description: for their 5th Team Challenge, the contestants were divided into 2 teams of 6 and had to cook a romantic entrée and desert for seventeen couples, including Gordon and his wife Tana.

5.title: Top 11 Compete
5.description: For their 5th Mystery Box Challenge, the judges presented 2 Mystery Boxes, one box had cheap ingredients and the other had expensive ingredients, the contestants had 60 minutes to create a dish using only one of the boxes.

5.title: Top 10 Compete
5.description: For their 6th Team Challenge, the cooks were divided into 2 teams and had 1 hour to make a turkey burger and fish taco for the football players and their fans. The players and fans would vote and the losing team will face the pressure test. The pressure test ends with an emotional elimination.

5.title: Top 8 Compete
5.description: For their next team challenge the cooks chose who they wanted to partner up with forming 4 teams of 2, each team would cook with a different body part of the chicken and the body part was randomly chosen.

5.title: Top 7 Compete
5.description: For the 6th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had 60 minutes to create an entrée using only apples. They can also include ingredients from the pantry.

5.title: Top 6 Compete
5.description: the remaining 6 contestants cooked dinner at restaurant with 50 guests. They had to replicate 2 appetizers and 2 entrees from the restaurant's menu. They have 1 hour to prep and 2 hours to serve the customers.

5.title: Top 5 Compete
5.description: In 60 minutes the remaining contestants and their loved ones picked the ingredients they needed to make their loved one's favorite dish.

5.title: Top 4 Compete
5.description: Team Challenge: The final four cooks were divided into two pairs. Courtney chose Elizabeth as her teammate on the Red Team, leaving Cutter and Leslie as the Blue Team. Each pair had to choose a box of ingredients from one of their home states. Courtney and Elizabeth chose Pennsylvania, and Leslie and Cutter chose Texas. Each pair then had to make an appetizer and an entrée based on what was in their box. Courtney and Elizabeth were narrowly judged as the winners, leaving Cutter and Leslie going head to head in the pressure test. Team Challenge Winners/Immune: Courtney...

5.title: Top 3 Compete
5.description: The last 3 cooks cooked an entrée for 50 chefs, symbolizing the 50 states of America. The 3 cooks randomly selected the eliminated contestants to help prepare the 50 portions. The cook with the most votes will advance to the finale.

5.title: The Finale
5.description: For the finale, Elizabeth and Courtney were required to cook a three course meal for each of the judges.

6.title: Top 40 Compete
6.description: Top 40 compete in a head to head challenge, to narrow it down to the top 20.

6.title: Top 22 Compete
6.description: In order to move to the next round, the home cooks must have an immense passion for food and be determined to out-cook their rivals in a series of head-to-head battles to earn a coveted white apron and compete for a chance to win the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize.

6.title: You're the Apple of My Eye
6.description: After the Battle for the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America will face their first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant is given 20 staple ingredients that anyone could find in their home and tasked with preparing a dish for the judges -- were the judges to show up at their homes for dinner. The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge will receive a significant advantage in the season's first pressure test, during which contestants must make their versions of an apple pie.

6.title: Cinnamon Roll-er Coaster
6.description: After the apple pie elimination test, the remaining 22 home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season at an amusement park. Once teams are decided, each team will be tasked with creating its version of an amusement park burger and fish and chips dish for thousands of amusement park guests. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will have to face the first pressure test of the season, during which the home cooks will make 12 cinnamon rolls. Find out which home cooks will continue to ride in the competition and who will ...

6.title: Clawing to Victory
6.description: In the next mystery box challenge, the home cooks will have to come out of their shells when they must prepare unique crab dishes for the judges. The home cook who prepares the best crab dish will receive a significant advantage before the next elimination challenge. Then the remaining home cooks will create their versions of sweet or savory dishes, using the same surprise ingredient of corn.

6.title: What Happens in Vegas Steaks in Vegas
6.description: In the second field challenge of the season, the home cooks will take a surprise trip to Las Vegas, where they will be split into two teams to take over Drai's Nightclub and feed 101 Las Vegas performers. The team who receives the most winning votes from the Las Vegas performer diners will be safe from the next pressure test, while the losing team will be dealt with a deuce steak contest at Gordon Ramsay's Steak. In the pressure test, the home cooks will face two steak challenges testing temperature and taste, and one contestant will be sent home for good.

6.title: Bring Home the Bacon
6.description: In the next challenge, it's proven that Breakfast is indeed the most important meal of the day when the home cooks are each tasked to create an elevated breakfast dish in 45 minutes. Not only will the winner have immunity in the next mystery box challenge, but they will also receive two additional advantages. Later, in the mystery box challenge, contestants must create TV dinners. Find out who will go home and who will bring it home.

6.title: Happy Birthday MasterChef
6.description: In the next team challenge, the remaining home cooks will celebrate a MASTERCHEF milestone, the 100th episode! Each team will prepare a two-course menu for the 100th episode celebration, during which VIP guests will dine on oyster and caviar appetizers and a duck breast entree, followed by a special surprise dish by judge Christina Tosi. The losing team will face the next pressure test, in which contestants must create a three-layer birthday cake in the special.

6.title: Gordon's Greatest Hits
6.description: In the next challenge, the remaining home cooks will learn from the best as they enter a special taste-it-and-make-it challenge. Each contestant must recreate Gordon Ramsay's signature Beef Wellington. The home cooks with the worst dishes will compete in the next pressure test, featuring another Gordon Ramsay dish - scallops with puree of English peas, bacon and quail eggs, finished with shaved truffles. Find out who can keep up with the master and who will be sent home for good.

6.title: Rice Rice Baby
6.description: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks will be faced with an assortment of rice. Each contestant must create a rice dish in 60 minutes. The contestant with the winning dish will be featured in Family Circle Magazine and will not have to participate in the next elimination challenge. Then, in the elimination challenge, contestants will be tasked with creating dishes based on dynamic duo ingredients. Find out who will make it into the Top 10 best home cooks in America and who will leave the MASTERCHEF kitchen.

6.title: Moo-vers and Bakers
6.description: The Top 10 home cooks enter the Wild West when they face their next team challenge and create steak meals for 101 cowboys and ranchers. The team that receives the most winning votes will moo-ve on in the competition, while the remaining home cooks will face the next pressure test. Back in the MASTERCHEF kitchen for the pressure test, the losing team will bake tarts and see who can bake their way to victory.

6.title: Family Reunion
6.description: The Top 10 home cooks will cook family style when they face their next team challenge and create family style meals for VIP diners. After each team prepares their family style meals, they are greeted by the dinner guests, their family members. Each diner will vote for one team's meal and the team with the most votes will be safe from the next pressure test. In the pressure test, the losing team home cooks must create a gnocchi-in-brown-sage-butter-sauce dish.

6.title: A Little Southern Flare
6.description: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks must prepare a flambe. The winner of the challenge will not only be safe from the next elimination challenge, but will also determine which Southern dish the contestants must make. The winner also will receive two other significant advantages. Find out whose cooking will go south and who will continue in the competition.

6.title: Getting A-Head in the Competition
6.description: In the next team challenge, the remaining home cooks will split into teams to prepare vegetarian meals for guests of the MASTERCHEF restaurant. Teams will have access to any ingredients that they choose in the MASTERCHEF pantry, as long as the dishes are vegetarian. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team must cook in the next pressure test and create delicious well-composed meals using various cuts from an animal head. Find out who will move on in the competition and who will leave the kitchen for good.

6.title: A Storm's a Brewing
6.description: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks must create a dish using coffee as one of the main ingredients. The winner of the challenge will receive a significant advantage in the next pressure test and will be safe from elimination. Then, during the pressure test, contestants will team up in pairs as they replicate an elaborate party platter.

6.title: The Restaurant Takeover
6.description: In the next team challenge, the Top Six home cooks will face the wildly popular restaurant takeover. Each team must complete two appetizer and two entree dishes for the dining guests in a downtown Los Angeles restaurant. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team must face the next pressure test, in which all members of the losing team must prep, cook and plate three different pasta dishes. Find out who can't stand the heat of the restaurant kitchen and who will move on to the Top 5.

6.title: Return of the Champions
6.description: In the next mystery box challenge, the Top Five home cooks must create a dish using pear, blue cheese, tomato, portabella mushroom and chocolate. The winner of the challenge receives two advantages: first, he/she will be safe from elimination; then the challenge winner will choose which of four different baskets filled with ingredients - put together on his/her own and with three former MASTERCHEF winners - the remaining contestants must cook with. Find out who will be one step closer to joining the champions and who will be eliminated.

6.title: Think Inside the Box
6.description: After learning from past champions in last week's episode, the four remaining contestants put that knowledge to use in the next team challenge. Using special ingredients provided by judges Gordon Ramsay and Graham Elliot, each team must create a unique appetizer and entree - and create them three times!. The winning pair will automatically move into the Top Three, while the losing pair must face the next pressure test, in which they must recreate judge Christina Tosi's world-famous Chocolate Malted Layer Cake. Find out who will be eliminated and who will take the cake...

6.title: Team Gordon Ramsay
6.description: The home cook with the most number of votes will move on in the competition, while the remaining two home cooks will face the next pressure test, during which they must complete three classic MASTERCHEF dishes. The home cook with the best dishes will move on to the finals.

6.title: The Finale
6.description: In the final challenge in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the Top Two home cooks will have one last chance to prove to the judges that they deserve the MASTERCHEF title by creating a three-course meal. After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, and the deserving home cook will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy, a book deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Find out whose culinary dreams will turn into a reality.

7.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 1
7.description: In the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Judging the battle rounds will be Ramsay and Tosi, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. In order to move to the next round of the competition, the home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be ...

7.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 2
7.description: In a continuation of the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America compete head-to-head in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt the to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title. The remaining home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals and make the next round.

7.title: Wolfgang Puck
7.description: After the Battle of the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America meet the first guest judge of the season - culinary icon Wolfgang Puck, who will introduce the season's first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create a dish of their choice that features one of the world's most fundamental ingredients - potatoes! The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge is rewarded with a significant decision going into the season's first elimination challenge, during which they will have to replicate one of Chef Ramsay's signature dishes in less ...

7.title: A Masterchef Wedding
7.description: In their first MASTERCHEF field challenge, the Top 18 home cooks are divided in to two teams where they will have to prepare appetizers and entrees for a very special guest and member of the MASTERCHEF family, season 6 contestant Nick Nappi on his wedding day! Not only will they feel the pressure from Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi and a former contestant but also Nick's bride and 72 hungry wedding guests. The winning team will earn a significant advantage in the next elimination challenge.

7.title: A Mexican Mystery
7.description: After a dramatic elimination, the remaining 17 home cooks are greeted by Chef Ramsay and Tosi, as well as special guests Season Six winner Claudia Sandoval and guest culinary judge Aaron Sanchez, as they reveal the next mystery box challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create his/her own unique dish using a number of Sandoval's favorite ingredients. The winner of the challenge will not only be safe from the next elimination round, but will also help in deciding the fate of three other contestants in the elimination. Find out who is saved and who survives ...

7.title: Gordon Ramsay Masterclass
7.description: This week, the remaining 16 home cooks get a very special treat leading into the next challenge, as Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to properly deconstruct a lobster. They will then each have 25 minutes to kill, poach and shell a lobster, just as they learned from the master, and the winner will have the advantage of choosing which team he or she will join for the next field challenge. For the second part of the challenge, Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to make lobster tortellini in a seafood broth. The contestants have 45 minutes to recreate Ramsay�۪s dish. ...

7.title: Vets, Jets, and Home Cooks
7.description: The remaining 15 cooks split up into two teams for their second major field challenge, which includes prepping and serving a steak, two side dishes and a sauce for 101 veterans, whose votes will determine which group will face the pressure test.

7.title: The Good, the Bad and the Offal
7.description: The contestants are introduced to special culinary guest judge Edward Lee, chef and owner of 610 Magnolia in Louisville, KY, who reveals the third Mystery Box challenge. Contestants lift their boxes only to find a $20 bill. They will each have five minutes to shop for ingredients priced in the pantry without spending more than $20. Then they will have 45 minutes to prepare four entree dishes to present to the judges. Not only will the winner and the winner's dish be featured in Family Circle magazine, but he/she also will avoid having to participate in the elimination...

7.title: A Piece of Cake
7.description: The contestants were split into two teams to prepare 30 portions for patrons that were celebrating their 16th birthdays. One team won with eighty percent of the votes and the losing team had to bake a three layer cake for the pressure test.

7.title: The Weakest Links
7.description: The losing contestants from the Sweet 16 Challenge in last week's episode are faced with the Birthday Cake pressure test and will have 90 minutes to bake a three-layer birthday cake. After a dramatic elimination, the remaining contestants are dropped off in the middle of a vegetable field and surprised by the judges - Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi and guest judge Edward Lee - who inform them of their next team field challenge. The teams go head-to-head with 75 minutes to prepare and cook their dishes, followed by 45 minutes to serve more than 100 hungry farmers.

7.title: Sweet Surprise
7.description: The Top 10 contestants have 60 minutes to prep, cook and plate a Nutella breakfast dish. The winner, who is safe from the next elimination challenge, also gets to choose what dish the other contestants must prepare for the challenge. Will it be paella, bibimbap or risotto.

7.title: 5 Star Food
7.description: Guest judge Kevin Sbraga cooks alongside the Top Nine in the next Mystery Box Challenge, as they create an impressive dish using unique upscale ingredients. The contestants then go head-to-head in the elimination challenge, cooking with either fresh salmon or canned salmon.

7.title: Hot Potato
7.description: The Top Eight face a three-part potato skill test. Find out which contestants get eliminated.

7.title: Tag Team
7.description: The seven remaining cooks compete in their next Mystery Box Challenge using three basic utensils to prepare two dishes. The contestants are paired up and go head-to-head in the elimination challenge to create a picnic platter.

7.title: Pop-Up Restaurant
7.description: The six remaining contestants compete in the series' classic pop-up restaurant challenge. Find out which contestants get eliminated.

7.title: Family Drama
7.description: The five remaining contestants are introduced to special culinary guest judge Richard Blais - chef, restaurateur and cookbook author - who reveals the seventh Mystery Box challenge. The winner will avoid competing in the elimination challenge and the remaining contestants are given five minutes to shop for a basket full of twenty ingredients. With an unexpected twist in the competition, one is eliminated.

7.title: Critics Choice
7.description: The four remaining contestants are given 90 minutes to prepare either a halibut or duck entrÃ©e for VIP food critics in the Studio Box challenge. The winning team will be exempt from the elimination challenge and the losing team will face the Pressure Test to recreate three pork dishes. Find out which contestants prove they have what it takes to be in the finale.

7.title: The Finale: Part 1
7.description: In the next challenge, with help from some familiar home cooks, the remaining three will have 60 minutes to prepare an amazing appetizer dish. In Part Two of the season finale, the contestants will have one hour to create entrees and an hour to create a dessert.

7.title: The Finale: Part 2
7.description: After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, and the deserving home cook will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy, a book deal and the $250,000 grand prize.Find out whose culinary dreams will turn into a reality.

8.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 1
8.description: In the Season Eight premiere episode, 40 of America's best home cooks travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle for a White Apron challenge, during which they will face off against each other to try to earn a place in the Top 20. Judging the battle rounds will be Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi, and new judge and award-winning chef Aarón Sánchez, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. After each battle, the judges will decide whom they think deserves to make it to the next round and a chance to compete for the coveted title.

8.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 2
8.description: In Part Two of the Battle for a White Apron, the remaining chefs compete for a spot in the Top 20. Only nine aprons remain and it will be up to the judges to decide who makes it and who goes home.

8.title: America's Grocery Bag
8.description: In their first mystery box challenge of the season, the Top 20 will have to take 12 of the most popular ingredients found on any American home cook's shopping list and make the judges a MASTERCHEF-worthy dish. Whoever wins the challenge will have a huge advantage moving forward in the competition.

8.title: Feeding the Lifeguards
8.description: The Top 19 take it to the sandy shore, where they will compete in their first team challenge of the season. The chefs will have to prepare and cook fresh fish for 101 lifeguards who will then vote on their favorite dish. The losing team will have to compete in a pressure test before the judges send one chef home.

8.title: Shell-Shocked & Scrambled
8.description: The Top 18 face a mystery box challenge that includes cooking some of the finest shellfish in the world. The winner will receive a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the rest of the chefs to compete in an elimination challenge where they will have to create a Gordon Ramsay classic. It is then up to the judges to decide who will leave the kitchen.

8.title: Silenced by the Lambs
8.description: This week on MASTERCHEF, the cooks take part in a challenging skills test, during which they must prepare racks of lamb with fine artistry. Those who fail to impress the judges will face an elimination challenge that includes recreating Gordon Ramsay's signature lamb chop dish. It is then up to the judges to decide who will leave the kitchen.

8.title: Breakfast, Lunch & Winner
